snippet: The Mississippi River could reach up to 10 feet above flood stage by the middle of next week in parts of Iowa, Illinois and Missouri, National Weather Service hydrologists said Wednesday.
abstract: National Weather Service says Mississippi River, so low for much of winter that barge traffic was nearly halted, could reach up to 10 feet above flood stage soon in parts of Iowa, Illinois and Missouri due to rain and storm forecasts.
lead_paragraph: The Mississippi River could reach up to 10 feet above flood stage by the middle of next week in parts of Iowa, Illinois and Missouri, National Weather Service hydrologists said Wednesday.

headline.seo: Missouri: Floods Predicted Along the Mississippi
headline.main: Missouri: Floods Predicted Along the Mississippi
headline.print_headline: Missouri: Floods Predicted Along the Mississippi
